instructions: Heat olive oil and butter in a pan over medium heat.
Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper, then sear for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream, stir, and simmer for 3-4 minutes until thickened.
Return salmon to the pan, spoon sauce over it, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Drizzle with lemon juice and serve hot.
Heat oil in a pot, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and salt; cook until tomatoes soften.
Add chicken thighs and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in rice, garam masala, and 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes until rice and chicken are cooked.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
Whip heavy cream with sugar and vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.
Fold in mascarpone cheese until smooth.
Mix coffee and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
Dip ladyfingers briefly in the coffee mixture and layer them in a dish.
Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Repeat with another layer of soaked ladyfingers and top with remaining mascarpone mixture.
Dust with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.
Marinate shrimp with turmeric, salt, and ginger-garlic paste for 20 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pan, add curry leaves, and let them splutter.
Add marinated shrimp and cook until they turn pink, about 5 minutes.
Stir in red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and tamarind paste.
Cook on medium heat until the masala coats the shrimp and oil separates, about 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with more curry leaves and serve hot.
Make slits on the pomfret fish.
Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, mustard oil, and salt to make a marinade.
Coat the fish with the marinade and let it sit for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place fish on a baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes, turning once, until cooked and slightly charred.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.
Marinate chicken with lemon juice, lemon zest, black pepper, garlic, olive oil, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the marinated chicken.
Cook for 6-8 minutes on each side until fully cooked and golden.
Garnish with parsley and serve hot.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cooking for 2 minutes.
Stir in turmeric, red chili powder, cumin powder, and salt.
Add chicken and cook until browned and tender, about 20 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or roti.
Grill chicken breasts with salt and pepper until cooked, then slice thinly.
Mix mayonnaise and mustard to make a spread.
Lay tortillas flat, spread the mayo-mustard mix, and layer with lettuce, tomato, and chicken.
Roll up the tortillas tightly and cut in half.
Serve immediately.
Whisk gram flour, yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, ginger paste, and salt with 3 cups water.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and curry leaves, and let them splutter.
Pour in the yogurt mixture and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Serve hot over cooked rice.
Whisk flour, eggs, milk, and a pinch of salt to make a smooth crepe batter.
Heat a non-stick pan, add a little butter, and pour batter to make thin crepes. Cook until lightly golden on both sides.
Mix shredded chicken with cream, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken mixture and cheese in the center of each crepe, fold, and serve warm.
Boil water with sugar and salt until dissolved, then stir in rice flour to make a dough.
Knead until smooth and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Fill a piping bag with the dough and pipe intricate shapes into hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy, then drain on paper towels.
Serve as a sweet snack.
Season calamari rings with salt, garlic powder, and paprika.
Dip each ring in beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.
Preheat air fryer to 200°C (400°F).
Spray calamari with cooking spray and air fry for 8-10 minutes until crispy.
Serve with a dipping sauce.
Wash bitter gourd slices and soak in salted water for 20 minutes to reduce bitterness, then drain.
Heat oil in a pan, add onions, and sauté until golden.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and salt, then stir in bitter gourd.
Cook on medium heat until tender, about 15 minutes.
Serve as a side dish.
Cook beef with salt and water until tender, then shred and set aside.
Heat oil in a pot, sauté onions until golden, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Stir in turmeric, cumin powder, rice, and lentils.
Add 4 cups of water and shredded beef, bring to a boil, then simmer for 25 minutes until cooked.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt, cooking for 2 minutes.
Add duck pieces and cook until browned.
Add 1 cup water, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes until tender.
Stir in garam masala and cook for 5 more minutes.
Serve hot with rice or roti.
Mix yogurt, tomato paste, paprika, cumin, garlic, olive oil, and salt to make a marinade.
Marinate chicken cubes for at least 2 hours.
Thread chicken onto skewers.
Grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked.
Serve with flatbread and salad.
Mix crab meat, cream cheese, green onions, garlic powder, and soy sauce.
Place a teaspoon of filling in the center of each wonton wrapper.
Fold wrappers into triangles or purses, sealing edges with water.
Heat oil and fry until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.
Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, then blend into a puree.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Sauté onion and garlic until golden.
Add red chili powder and salt, then stir in spinach puree.
Cook for 5-7 minutes until flavors meld.
Serve hot with roti or rice.
Roast cashew nuts in a dry pan until golden, then cool.
In a bowl, combine mixed greens, cucumber, tomato, and cashews.
Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make a dressing.
Toss salad with dressing and serve fresh.
Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt for 1 hour.
Heat butter in a pan, add marinated chicken, and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato puree and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add heavy cream, cook for 5 more minutes, and adjust salt.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with naan or rice.
Wash rice and soak for 30 minutes, then drain.
Boil milk with cardamom pods, then add rice and simmer until cooked, about 20 minutes.
Stir in jaggery until dissolved, then add raisins and cashews.
Cook for 5 more minutes and remove from heat.
Serve warm or chilled.
Marinate tuna steaks with olive oil, soy sauce, black pepper, garlic powder, lemon juice, and salt for 20 minutes.
Heat a skillet over high heat, sear tuna for 2-3 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Rest for 5 minutes, then slice and serve.
Mix ground chicken with onion, breadcrumbs, ginger, garlic, garam masala, egg, and salt.
Shape into small balls.
Heat oil in a pan and fry koftas until golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Serve with sauce or curry.
Roast dried shrimp in a dry pan, then grind coarsely.
Mash boiled eggs with a fork.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions and chilies until golden.
Mix in shrimp powder, mashed eggs, and salt.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, garnish with cilantro, and serve with rice.
Butterfly the fish and season with turmeric, cumin, salt, and lemon juice.
Brush with olive oil and grill over an open flame or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve with bread or rice.
Boil water with sugar, then stir in semolina and ghee to make a dough.
Knead until smooth, then roll out and cut into decorative shapes.
Heat oil and fry until golden brown.
Drain and serve as a sweet treat.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Stir in turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.
Add tilapia fillets and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 10 minutes until fish is cooked.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.
Bring chicken broth to a boil, add ginger, garlic, and chili flakes.
Stir in shrimp and cook until pink, about 5 minutes.
Add fish sauce and lime juice, adjust seasoning.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
Season steaks with salt and pepper, then sear in olive oil for 4-5 minutes per side. Set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter, sauté garlic and mushrooms until soft.
Add heavy cream and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Return steaks to the pan, coat with sauce, and serve hot.
Cook lamb with salt and water until tender, then reserve broth.
Heat ghee, sauté onions until golden, then add cumin seeds.
Stir in rice, raisins, carrots, and lamb broth (4 cups).
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes until rice is cooked.
Top with lamb pieces and serve.

ingredients: 1 cup sugar syrup (sugar and water boiled)
instructions: Mix semolina, sugar, yogurt, oil, baking powder, and coconut flakes into a batter.
Pour into a greased pan and bake at 180°C (360°F) for 25 minutes.
Pour sugar syrup over the hot cake and let it soak.
Cut into pieces and serve.
Marinate goat meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, and salt for 2 hours.
Fry onions until golden, then layer half in a pot.
Add marinated meat, then partially cooked rice, remaining onions, and ghee.
Seal pot and cook on low heat for 1 hour.
Garnish with mint and serve.
Boil cabbage leaves until soft, then drain.
Mix ground beef, rice, onion, egg, salt, and pepper.
Place filling in each cabbage leaf and roll tightly.
Place rolls in a pot, cover with tomato sauce, and simmer for 45 minutes.
Serve hot.
Marinate quails with ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt for 1 hour.
Heat oil in a pan and roast quails until golden and cooked, about 20 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

ingredients: Fresh cilantro and lemon slices for garnish
instructions: Boil rice noodles, strain, and rinse under cold water.
Roast whole spices and onion in a pan, then add water, ginger-garlic paste, shrimp paste, chili flakes, tamarind paste, and salt to make a broth.
Cook broth for 15 minutes.
Serve noodles in a bowl, topped with fried onion, boiled egg, dried shrimp powder, and hot broth.
Garnish with cilantro and lemon slices.
Marinate prawns with turmeric, salt, and ginger-garlic paste for 20 minutes.
Heat ghee, add curry leaves, and let them splutter.
Add prawns and cook until pink, about 5 minutes.
Stir in red chili powder, cumin powder, and tamarind paste.
Cook until masala coats prawns, about 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve.
Mix chicken and beef with onion, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Shape onto skewers.
Heat oil in a pan or grill, cook kebabs until browned, about 15 minutes.
Serve with dips and salad.
Heat butter, sauté onions until golden.
Roast red chilies and garlic, then blend with yogurt.
Add chicken to the pan, cook until browned.
Stir in yogurt mixture and garam masala, simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot with naan.
Cook beef with salt and water until tender, reserve broth.
Heat oil, sauté onions, then add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, and kala bhuna masala.
Stir in rice, lentils, and beef broth (4 cups).
Add beef and simmer for 25 minutes until cooked.
Serve hot.
Heat oil in a pan, add bay leaf and cardamom, and let them splutter.
Sauté onion until golden, then add carrot and peas.
Stir in cooked rice and soy sauce, cook for 5 minutes.
Adjust salt and serve hot.
Whip heavy cream with sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks form.
Fold in mascarpone cheese and mango puree.
Dip ladyfingers in mango puree and layer in a dish.
Spread half the mascarpone mixture over them.
Repeat layering and top with remaining mixture.
Refrigerate for 4 hours before serving.
Roast moong dal, wash, and set aside.
Fry fish head with salt and turmeric until golden, then set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onions until brown, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Stir in spices, dal, and water, cook until dal is soft.
Add fish head and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
Marinate chicken with all spices, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, fried onion, and mustard oil for 1 hour.
Heat oil, add marinated chicken, and cook until browned.
Simmer until chicken is tender and gravy thickens, about 30 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or roti.
Mix flour, egg, cold water, baking powder, and salt to make a batter.
Dip shrimp in batter.
Heat oil and fry shrimp until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Drain and serve with dipping sauce.
Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, lemon juice, and salt for 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place chicken on a tray and bake for 30-35 minutes, turning once.
Serve hot with naan.

ingredients: Croutons and mozzarella cheese for topping
instructions: Heat butter and olive oil, sauté beef brisket until browned, then add onions.
Cook until onions are soft, then add spices, soy sauce, and cornstarch.
Pour in beef broth, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Shred beef and return to soup.
Top with croutons and mozzarella, air fry at 400°F until cheese melts.
Serve hot.
Marinate chicken with cream, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, white pepper, and salt for 2 hours.
Thread onto skewers.
Grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve with chutney.
Cook beef with salt and water until tender, reserve broth.
Heat ghee, sauté onions until golden, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Stir in spices, rice, and beef broth (4 cups).
Add beef and simmer for 20 minutes until rice is cooked.
Serve hot.
Boil milk, add lemon juice to curdle, then strain to make chhana.
Knead chhana with sugar and cardamom until smooth.
Shape into small balls and serve fresh.
Marinate beef with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, and salt for 2 hours.
Fry onions until golden, layer half in a pot.
Add marinated beef, then partially cooked rice, remaining onions, and ghee.
Seal pot and cook on low heat for 1 hour.
Garnish with mint and serve.
Cook sticky rice according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat coconut milk, condensed milk, and vanilla essence until thickened.
Mix rice with half the sauce, cook until absorbed.
Serve rice with mango slices and remaining sauce.
Fry eggs, sausages, and bacon in butter until cooked.
Grill tomato halves and sauté mushrooms.
Toast bread and butter it.
Serve all components together on a plate.
Make buttermilk by mixing milk and lemon juice.
Dissolve coffee in hot water, then melt with chocolate and oil.
Sift dry ingredients, mix with sugar.
Combine wet and dry ingredients with eggs, pour into a greased pan.
Bake at 160°C (325°F) for 40 minutes.
Top with ganache and serve.
Roast moong dal, wash, and set aside.
Fry fish head with salt and turmeric until golden, then set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onions until brown, then add ginger-garlic paste.
Stir in spices, dal, and water, cook until dal is soft.
Add fish head and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
Make chhana by curdling 600 ml milk with lemon juice, strain, and mash.
Boil 450 ml milk with cardamom, add chhana.
When thickened, add condensed milk and ghee, cook until set.
Pour into a greased pan, cool for 1 hour, and cut into pieces.

ingredients: Fresh mint and chilies for garnish
instructions: Marinate snapper with lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, soy sauce, black pepper, and olive oil.
Add diced onion, capsicum, mint, and chilies.
Wrap in foil and bake at 200°C (400°F) for 30-40 minutes.
Serve hot.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Sauté egg, sausage, shrimp, and chicken with salt and paprika, set aside.
Heat olive oil, caramelize onion and garlic, add tomatoes and chili-garlic sauce.
Simmer for 10 minutes, then toss in spaghetti and proteins.
Serve hot.
Heat ghee, sauté cumin seeds and onion until golden.
Stir in turmeric, rice, and salt.
Add 4 cups water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.
Heat oil, sauté onion with panch phoron until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chicken, cumin, coriander, and salt.
Stir in spinach puree and cook until water reduces.
Add rice and 4 cups water, cook until done.
Top with a fried egg and serve.
Heat mustard oil, sauté panch phoron and dried chilies.
Add garlic cloves and spices, cook until soft.
Stir in tamarind paste and jaggery, simmer for 10 minutes.
Cool and store in a jar.
Heat oil, sauté onions and chilies until soft.
Add fish fillets, soy sauce, chili flakes, and salt.
Cook until fish is done, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.dish_name: Jeera Rice, Creamy Fish, Brussel Sprouts
instructions: Heat ghee, sauté cumin seeds, add rice and 4 cups water, cook until done.
Marinate fish with ginger-garlic paste and salt, cook in a pan with cream until tender.
Steam brussel sprouts until tender.
Serve rice with creamy fish and brussel sprouts.
Spread butter on bread slices.
Sprinkle with garlic powder, chili flakes, and salt.
Toast in a pan or oven until crispy.
Serve warm.
Coat eggplants with coconut paste, mustard seeds, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, and salt, then fry until golden.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions with panch phoron until soft.
Add spices, tamarind water, sugar, and fried eggplants.
Cook until flavors meld, about 10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
Prepare parathas and lentil curry separately.
Fry egg with salt and set aside.
Sauté onions and chilies in oil.
Serve parathas with lentil curry, fried egg, and sautéed onions.
Boil water with soy sauce, chili sauce, chili flakes, black pepper, and bouillon.
Add chicken and carrot, cook until tender.
Stir in cornstarch slurry to thicken.
Pour in beaten egg, stirring to create threads.
Serve hot.
Remove mushroom stems and chop finely.
Sauté garlic and stems in olive oil.
Mix with cream cheese and salt, stuff into mushroom caps.
Top with breadcrumbs and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 20 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve.
Mix semolina, yogurt, sugar, oil, baking powder, and coconut flakes into a batter.
Pour into a greased pan, bake at 180°C (360°F) for 25 minutes.
Pour sugar syrup over hot cake and let it soak.
Cut into pieces and serve.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add chicken, turmeric, garam masala, and salt, cook until browned.
Stir in rice and 4 cups water, simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.
Marinate chicken with cilantro, mint, ginger-garlic paste, green chili, yogurt, and salt for 2 hours.
Thread onto skewers.
Grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes.
Serve with chutney.
Blend soaked lentils coarsely, mix with onion, chilies, spices, gram flour, baking powder, and salt.
Shape into fritters.
Heat oil and fry until crispy and golden.
Serve hot.
Make koftas with chicken, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, and salt, then air fry.
Heat ghee, sauté onions, add spices, yogurt, and rice.
Add water and cook rice halfway, then layer with koftas.
Cook on low heat for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.
Mash potatoes with chilies, onion, mustard oil, and salt for bhorta.
Cook lentils with turmeric and salt until soft.
Serve bhorta and daal together with rice.
Marinate beef with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours.
Heat ghee, sauté onions, add beef, and cook until 80% done.
Add chickpeas, rice, and water, cook until rice is done.
Serve hot.
Marinate chicken with spices and salt, fry until golden.
Heat ghee, sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste and yogurt.
Add chicken and cook until tender, about 30 minutes.
Serve hot.
Fry eggplant slices until golden, set aside.
Cook chicken with salt and spices, reserve broth.
Layer chicken, eggplant, and rice in a pot, add broth.
Cook until rice is done, then invert onto a plate.
Serve hot.
Cook rice with orange color and peel until 80% done.
Heat ghee, sauté nuts, add sugar and rice, cook until syrupy.
Mix milk and condensed milk, cook until thickened for malai.
Serve rice topped with malai and nuts.
Make dough with flour and water, roll out, and fill with seasoned chicken for momos.
Steam momos for 15 minutes.
Boil broth with ginger, soy sauce, and chili flakes for soup.
Serve momos with hot soup.
Marinate chicken with egg, cornstarch, and spices, fry until crispy.
Heat ghee, sauté onions, add spices and rice.
Layer rice with fried chicken, cook on low for 20 minutes.
Serve hot.
Mix beef with onion, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and salt.
Shape onto skewers.
Fry in butter until browned, about 15 minutes.
Serve hot.
Mix tuna, potato, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, egg yolk, and salt.
Shape into patties, coat with egg white and breadcrumbs.
Fry until golden, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
Marinate fish with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, lemon juice, and mustard oil for 1 hour.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 50 minutes, broil for a few minutes.
Serve hot.
Sauté vermicelli and nuts in ghee until golden.
Simmer milk until reduced, add condensed milk and sugar.
Stir in vermicelli and nuts, cook until thickened.
Serve warm or chilled.
Cook beef, lentils, and wheat with salt until tender, blend into a paste.
Heat ghee, sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste and garam masala.
Mix in blended mixture, cook until thick.
Serve hot.
Mix butter, garlic, chili flakes, and salt.
Spread on bread, top with cheese.
Air fry at 200°C (400°F) for 5-6 minutes.
Serve hot.
Mix chicken with onion, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, egg, and salt.
Shape into patties, coat with breadcrumbs.
Fry until golden, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
Heat ghee, roast semolina until golden.
Add sugar, milk, and cardamom, cook until thickened.
Pour into a greased plate, cool, and cut into pieces.
Serve.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, spices, and shrimp.
Cook until shrimp is pink and masala coats it, about 10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add spices and dried fish, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in beans, water, and salt, cook until tender, about 20 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.
